Mike & Donna are kind & friendly and have thought of everything. They are there if needed—yet with the perfect balance of giving you privacy as well.
Your accommodations are extremely clean ( super important to me) & honestly—you wont want to leave.
Restaurants, tourist attractions, & vintage shops are amazing & nearby- but (thankfully in my opinion) not walkable. However, evenings by the moonlight with s’mores and/or wine, and comfy chairs are right outside your door.
It’s one of those places that you know you will come back to. We were super happy & felt like we made new friends. It will be our go- to place when visiting beautiful Marietta.

I rented this space to host boudoir sessions, and it was exactly what I was hoping for! The unique design lent itself well to the lens, and my models were very impressed.
I didn't stay overnight at all since dogs aren't permitted to visit (I have three and couldn't leave them home alone), so I can't speak to that side of the experience. However, I found the listing quite enjoyable overall. I found myself wanting to be there as much as possible.
Pros:
- Location (Surprisingly quiet, surprisingly spacious, great view of Front Street, SO close to many top attractions)
- Overall design/style (especially the Rousch painting, kitchen, neon light near the front window, trinkets hidden in the bricks above the stairs, teal green chairs, prints in the hallway going to the bedroom, main bathroom with clawfoot tub)
- Laundry offerings (though I didn't use them)
- "Hosting" amenities (tons of seating options, variety of glassware, cocktail shaker, wine accessories, cigar box, etc.)
- Variety of toiletries in the main bathroom cover all of the essentials (band-aids, acetone, Q-tips, makeup remover, lotions, etc.)
- Huge bedroom closet
- Wide variety of books & chaise lounge was very comfortable
- Check-in and out procedures were extremely easy
- Parking can be rough downtown, but it was very easy and accessible.
- Stairs weren't overwhelming; I expected more of a climb.
